medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe visual impairment in the right eye due to a classic choroidal neovascular membrane.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient first noticed distorted and blurred vision in the right eye 2 months before her initial evaluation in 1995, with symptoms progressively worsening over time. A similar neovascular lesion developed in the fellow eye 5 years later.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Clinical history of endometriosis treated with oral birth-control pills.
medical_history.family_history: The father had a visual acuity of 20/40 and displayed multiple radial drusen, the older sister had a visual acuity of 20/20 with very discrete hard drusen, and the younger sister had a visual acuity of 20/20 with no changes. The mother's examination was normal.
